ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Lab research.
So much insight into the real workings of a lab, able to gain and improve scientific research skills and develop a more practical understanding of research
independent research and data analysis
Experience in a research laboratory, and writing grant proposals, research reports, and making a scientific poster for presentations
I learned how a lab runs, how to write a research paper, and how to make a poster. I learned from the people in my lab not from the MCDB instructors

I learned the basic process of research and reporting my findings. I also learned how to navigate myself through an unstructured work process to find answers to questions that I have. I also learned how to reach out to those who can help me in the process of finding these answers.
learned about grant writing, designing, and carrying out a research project on my own
I was guided in conducting my yearlong research project.
I expanded in my existing skill set conducting research in an MCDB laboratory while fulfilling the written thesis requirements of the major.
How to be an academic researcher in science.
basic wet lab procedures, writing scientific report and presenting data

I was able to improve my wet lab abilities and my experimental design skills through this course especially when I ran into issues with a specific experiment and had to come up with solutions and ideas to improve future runs. I also had to meticulously plan out when to run certain parts of the experiment since there were certain times where I couldn't be in the lab and I had to take that into consideration.
good

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I appreciate the freedom given to students to persue their scientific topic of interest and conduct research at their own pace.

It would have been better if there was a more organized Canvas page with all the info and deadlines clearly listed so students wouldn't have to dig into the documents. I also wished the department would communicate about the dates of presentation / poster session earlier in the spring so that I could have a good sense of my schedule earlier on.

This is entirely dependent on your lab. Outside of the lab, there is largely no support to help you troubleshoot issues you may have, so if that support is also lacking in your lab and/or there are major issues in your lab, you are completely on your own.
None. Independent Research. Speaks for itself.

Very individualised and a high work load but really good for any science student, weaknesses were that there were very few assessments themselves. Student grading in the presentation section are also something that I would discourage.
good
based on the lab you are in for senior research
This course is disorganized and the MCDB department offers little to no guidance to the students in the class. It is great to get real world lab experience but I felt so lost all the time.

Being able to work on exactly what you want to work on is a great strength of this course. Another strength is making your own schedule and sticking to it, as it allows you to work when you feel that you will be most efficient.
more transparency and communication regarding deadlines, and also more flexibility since everyone's research timeline is very different
not much guidance from the instructors of the course, just a syllabus to go off of
There could have been more communication between admin and students.

Strengths - working with my PI that I have known for multiple years on a novel and unique research project and having the opportunity to present at lab meeting made this experience very special. Course communication between the DUS/course managers was also timely and helpful. 

Weaknesses - assignments (like the final senior essay guidelines, poster guidelines, and oral presentation guidelines) were not posted in final revised form to Canvas until April. It would have been very helpful to see these in January or at the start of the semester to get a head start on the written components of the majors research requirements. Additionally, I would have preferred that extra funding in MCDB be directed toward covering the cost of printing student posters rather than the MCDB gift. While the gift was appreciated, printing high quality posters is quiet expensive and anything available in the departments budget to help defray this cost would have been great.
Offers students the opportunity to have ownership over a research project. Would have benefited from some additional guidance from the course directos through lectures or other resources.

For folks who arent published/havent worked on putting together a scientific paper before, it would have been extremely helpful to include more resources and specific guidelines for how to write the final research report. There was literally one example uploaded to Canvas and it was not useful. Assignment descriptions were vague and seemed to imply we should be relying on our PI for guidelines, but if your PI wants to know what guidelines the MCDB department wants you to follow (as mine did), it turns into a vicious cycle of no one knowing what instructions to give.

A weakness was having a PowerPoint presentation, written paper, and poster presentation due during the last week of classes. Please spread out the assignments so they do not overlap with other courses.

Your experience mostly depends on the lab and mentor that you have. In terms of assignments, they are heavier during the spring semester and the oral presentation could probably be done before the final report and poster to reduce the amount of stress during the final week of semester.
good

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely not. If you can get your senior thesis requirement finished in another way (taking 3 classes instead of doing research) do that, unless you have spent time in your lab before the fall and know that it is a supportive environment.
Of course. This is the best way to get research experience and get credit for it! Very cool!
yes, for major
required for MCDB BS

It is necessary for graduation but was not a highlight of Yale. I enjoyed working in my lab but wish the MCDB dept checked in, guided us on the final assessments, or facilitated meetings between the students.
If this student is interested in the MCDB major and working in research, I would recommend this course.
It is a requirement of the MCDB major.
Yes, it's very fulfilling to complete a senior research project, could to have that experience and exposure.

Its required to graduate with the MCDB degree, but Id recommend it over 495/496, particularly if youre double majoring. The thesis is a lot of work throughout the year, from hours in the lab to the writing of the final research paper, making the poster, and many, many presentations. Dont wait until the last minute to work on any of these things!
good
